summary: EDITORIAL Journal of Virology (JVI) marks its 50th year of publishing in 2017. the editors have selected articles from 2014 and 2015. CHIKV is an alphavirus transmitted by mosquitoes, mainly Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus. ti and 96.7% in A. albopictus populations indicate a high risk of establishment and spread of CHIKV throughout tropical, subtropical, and even temperate regions of the Americas. early antiretroviral treatment, even when continued for >10 years, is unlikely to lead to virus eradication. onavirus (MERS-CoV) has caused more than 900 human infections with 40% mortality. animals are needed to study MERS-CoV pathogenesis and for the development of preventive and therapeutic agents. several entry factors, including DC-SIGN, AXL, and Tyro3, allowed ZIKV entry. further, ZIKV induced the transcription of toll-like receptor 3 (TLR3), RIG-I, and MDA5.
